title: Multi Image Super Resolution Modeling for Earth System Models
author: Ehsan Zeraatkar (Computer Science, Texas State University), Salah A Faroughi (Chemical Engineering, University of Utah), Jelena Tesić (Computer Science, Texas State University), ...
background: The paper addresses the challenge of enhancing the spatial resolution of climate model data through super-resolution techniques, particularly focusing on Earth System Models (ESMs).
contribution: This paper introduces the ViFOR algorithm combining Vision Transformers and Fourier Representation Networks to improve the generation of high-resolution images from low-resolution inputs in climate modeling.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing models like Vision Transformers and Generative Adversarial Networks struggle with high-frequency details in images.
technical_comparison.novelty: ViFOR improves upon this by utilizing Fourier transform filters to independently target low and high-frequency components, effectively addressing spectral bias.

key_innovation: The use of Fourier-based activation functions in conjunction with Vision Transformers to enhance super-resolution capabilities.
real_world_impact: The proposed method has implications for improving climate data analyses, which could lead to more accurate regional climate predictions. However, its immediate practical application in real-world scenarios is not evident yet.
limitations: The paper does not explicitly mention any limitations.

new_terms.Fourier Representation Networks: **Fourier Representation Networks** refer to neural network architectures that leverage Fourier transforms to better capture frequency components of data, thus improving performance on tasks like super-resolution.
